name: Apurwa Agrawal
bio:
Apurwa Agrawal is an Architect with a Master's in Interior Architecture and Design from CEPT University, Ahmedabad. 
She has been involved and has an understanding  on subjects  like Crafts and Design collaboration, History Theory & Criticism and Generative Design Process in the due course of her post graduation.

tab_details.Research Interests: Crafts and Design collaboration, History Theory & Criticism and Generative Design Process

name: Auro Ashish Ghosh
bio: Having trained under some of the best architects in India, he has a good insight into evolution of the architectural scenario in India and abroad. A product of CET Bhubaneswar with a specialization in Architectural Conservation from SPA Delhi, his grasp on heritage adds to the aforementioned in understanding the contextual complexities of the built-unbuilt environment.

name: Himanshu Sekhar Panda
bio: Dr. Himanshu Sekhar Panda graduated from UCE, Burla (now VSSUT, Burla), Odisha in the year 1992. He worked with several construction companies till 2008. He then Left industry and joined academics. Got master’s degree in structural engineering specialization from CET, Bhubaneswar in 2010 and Ph. D. in structural engineering from NIT, Rourkela in 2016. Areas of interest – Structural Analysis and Design, Dynamic analysis and testing of laminated and delaminated composite structures under influence hygro-thermal environment. Some of the research papers are listed below.
publications: • H. S. Panda, S. K. Sahu and P.K. Parhi (2013): Hygrothermal effects on free vibration of delaminated woven fiber composite plates - Numerical and experimental results, Composite Structures (Elsevier), Vol.96, pp. 502-513 (SCI).

• H. S. Panda, S. K. Sahu, P.K. Parhi and A.V. Asha (2015): Vibration of woven fiber composite doubly curved panels with strip delamination in thermal field, Journal of Vibration and Control (SAGE), Vol. 21 (15), pp. 3072-3089 (SCI).

• H. S. Panda, S. K. Sahu and P.K. Parhi (2014): Effects of moisture on the frequencies of vibration of woven fiber composite doubly curved panels with strip delaminations, Thin Walled Structures (Elsevier), Vol.78, pp.79-86 (SCI).

• H. S. Panda, S. K. Sahu and P.K. Parhi (2015): Buckling behavior of bidirectional composite flat panels with delaminations in hygrothermal field, Acta Mechanica (Springer), Vol. 226 (6), pp.1971-1992 (SCI).

• H. S. Panda, S. K. Sahu and P.K. Parhi (2015): Hygrothermal response on parametric instability of delaminated bidirectional composite flat panels, European Journal of Mechanics A/Solids (Elsevier), Vol.53, pp.268-281 (SCI).

• H. S. Panda, S. K. Sahu and P.K. Parhi (2016): Thermal effects on parametric instability of delaminated woven fabric composite curved panels, International Journal of Structural Stability and Dynamics (World Scientific), Vol. 16(10), pp.1750008(24 pages) (SCI). International Conferences

• S. K. Sahu, H. S. Panda and P.K. Parhi (2013): Numerical and experimental studies on free vibration of delaminated woven fiber composite plates at elevated temperatures, Fourth International Conference on Recent Advances in Composite Materials (ICRACM - 2013), February 18-21 at Goa, India.

• S. K. Sahu, H. S. Panda and P.K. Parhi (2013): Thermal effects on vibration of delaminated composite doubly curved panels, Seventh International Conference on Materials for Advanced Technologies (ICMAT 2013), June 30- July 05 at Singapore.

• H. S. Panda, S. K. Sahu and P.K. Parhi (2013): Modal analysis of delaminated woven fiber composite plates in moist environment, International conference on Structural Engineering and Mechanics (ICSEM 2013), December 20-22, India.

name: Md K Iqbal
bio:
Mr Md K Iqbal is an Electrical Engineer (Infrastructure & Services) having +35 years of experience in the field of Electrical Designing & execution Building Projects and External Infrastructure, Project Management, have worked in close association with Architectural firms for more than 25 Years. Prepared Electrical Infrastructure Design for Smart City Project, Bhubaneswar for EGIS India.
Previously he has worked with Odisha State Electricity Board (OSEB), Odisha State Housing Board, Directorate of Export Promotion and Marketing, Hirakud Industrial Works, Grid Corporation of Odisha Ltd. (Formerly OSEB), Odisha Power Transmission Corporation Limited, Industrial Promotion and Investment Corporation of Odisha Ltd., Essar Steel Odisha Limited, Arcelor Mittal Design & Engineering Center and ARSS Infrastructure Projects Limited and Planning and Studies Directorate, Electricity and Water Authority, Kingdom of Bahrain.

name: Soumyendu Shankar Ray
bio: Soumyendu Shankar Ray has applied the design approaches he has taught for three decades to two generations of students, in his practice – adventurous juxtaposing of the conventional and the cutting edge, and the conservative and the avant-garde. His work is striking in the exciting departures within disciplined geometries, and radical reinterpretations of the traditional aesthetic in contemporary materials. As former Dean of the Faculty of Architecture, Biju Patnaik University of Technology, Odisha, and now the founding Director of the School of Architecture and Planning, KIIT University he has brought the professional and the academic together at Vastukar, the firm he founded in 1985. Nurtured through the decades when architecture was little-known in the state, Vastukar is now one of the largest and most respected firms in the region for Architecture, Planning and Urban Design. His research interest led to the fruition of 'Vastukar Foundation', a research based non-profit organization on sustainable built environment and conservation studies. He is the author of the book ‘Odisha-an architectural odyssey’, a comprehensive timeline perspective of architectural evolution of the region.

name: Sovan Saha
bio: Sovan Saha is an Architect and Urban Designer with more than ten years of experience, including industry and academics. He completed his under graduation Bachelor of Architecture (B.Arch) from Jadavpur University, Kolkata in 2011. He holds a postgraduate degree in Urban Design from School of Planning and Architecture (SPA), New Delhi. Sovan has worked as urban design consultant in multiple urban level projects. He was engaged in various architectural and public space design projects while working with renowned architectural organizations and one developer company based in Kolkata. He is skilled in Creative Concept Design, Placemaking and Project Planning & Execution. Sovan has been active in the field of academics and continuing his research work focused on urban affairs since 2019 onwards. He was associated with Jadavpur University Kolkata as a guest faculty, with India Institute of Engineering Science and Technology (IIEST), Shibpur as an Assistant Professor (on contract) and with Amity University Kolkata as an Assistant Professor (Grade-I). Presently he is a regular faculty in KIIT (Deemed to be University), Bhubaneswar and working as an Assistant Professor (Grade-II) at the KIIT School of Architecture and Planning. Besides he is pursuing his Doctoral Research Work at National Institute of Technology (NIT), Rourkela.

tab_details.Memberships: Registered Member of Council of Architecture (CoA) and Institute of Urban Designers India (IUDI)

publications: Banerjee, P., & Saha, S. (2020, September 7). Eclecticism in Architecture - ‘Laha Bari’, A Case Study in the City of Joy. International Journal of Creative Research Thoughts (IJCRT), 8(9), 1011 - 1023.

Banerjee, P., & Saha, S. (2020, December). Eclecticism in Architecture: Panchakot Palace A Pictorial Case Study in Purulia, West Bengal. International Journal for Research in Applied Science and Engineering Technology (IJRASET), 8(XII), 82-97.

Banerjee, P., & Saha, S. (2021, May 27). Spatial Arrangement for Healthy and Safe Built Environment in Slums. International Journal of All Research Education and Scientific Methods (IJARESM), 9(5), 3057-3073.

name: Suryendu Dasgupta
bio: Dr. Suryendu Dasgupta is an architect and urban designer working in the field of urban heritage management. His research focuses specifically on exploring and developing heritage conservation approaches as a collaborative effort, with the participation of the community and responding to their aspirations and expectations. His PhD research led to the development of a comprehensive heritage management approach for colonial hill stations in India, within the context of Darjeeling. The outcome of the research promoted equilibrium between urban development, built heritage protection and expectations of the local community, thus aligning with the UNESCO Heritage Urban Landscape approach. He was also a DAAD Research Scholar, involved in a collaborative project between IIT Roorkee and RWTH Aachen, for developing an "Indo-German Centre for Experimental Architecture and Material Culture". He has also worked as a Project Fellow in IIT Roorkee in the project "Campus Accessibility and Inclusion of Diversity" that aims towards making the campus accessible to all its stakeholders at multiple and diverse levels of functions, spanning academics and administration, guided by the principles of Universal Design and Accessibility.

tab_details.Administrative Responsibility: Course Coordinator 4th Year B.Arch, M. Arch. (Urban Design) Coordinator, Coordinator Timetable, Tutor Mentor 4th Year B.Arch.

name: Sweta Samal
bio: Sweta Samal an urban designer with over 6 years of experience, she has been part of a few prestigious projects being associated with some of the best architects in India. Her repertoire of work ranges from spatial development plans, urban design to architecture.

tab_details.Research Interests: Specialization in Urban design, Interest : Urban landscape, Streetscape
